Nicholas was a freshman at a reputed university, excited to pursue his dream career in journalism. However, his enthusiasm faded soon when he faced several writing assignments that seemed daunting to him. He tried his best to write creatively and logically, but his articles lacked coherence and structure. He reached out to his instructors and peers, but they were too busy to provide feedback and guidance. Nicholas felt frustrated and hopeless. It seemed like he was bound to fail, and his dream was shattered.
Fast forward to a few months, Nicholas discovered ChatGPT, an AI-based writing assistant that could help him with his writing assignments. At first, he was skeptical, but he decided to give it a try. To his amazement, ChatGPT provided him with instant feedback, suggestions, and tips to improve his writing. He could ask ChatGPT questions, and it would answer them in a matter of seconds. Nicholas felt empowered and confident in his writing skills, and he was inspired to pursue his dream career with renewed enthusiasm.
Here are ten advantages of using ChatGPT for first-year writing opinion:
In conclusion, ChatGPT is a powerful writing tool that can revolutionize the way students learn and write. It provides them with personalized feedback, suggestions, and tips that can improve their writing skills, enhance their creativity, and develop their critical thinking. It also promotes collaboration, reduces procrastination, and prepares them for their future careers. Using ChatGPT can enhance the learning experience and make it more engaging, interactive, and fun. It is a boon to first-year writing opinion, and it has the potential to transform the way we teach and learn.

When I had my first child, returning to work seemed almost impossible. I struggled with the decision to leave my baby in someone else's care while I worked to provide for our family. But, as a working mother, I soon discovered that there were ways that architecture and parenting practices could help aid my return to work and make the transition smoother for both me and my baby.
One way that architecture can help parents return to work is by designing for parenthood. This means creating spaces that are both functional and comfortable for parents and children. For example, workplaces could provide designated lactation rooms that are convenient and private for breastfeeding mothers. Or, coworking spaces could offer on-site child care services with trained professionals. This would not only benefit the parents but, it would also create an inclusive and family-friendly environment for all employees.
Architecture is not the only solution. Balancing work and parenting requires strategy and practice. One way to balance work and parenting is by setting boundaries. Establishing specific work hours and childcare hours, free from interruptions and distractions, can make your time more productive and focused. Additionally, utilizing technologies like video conferencing, productivity apps, and online calendars can help to streamline your work and home life.
Finally, the support system around you can make all the difference. Having a reliable network of family, friends, or coworkers you can depend on can help with the transition back to work. Seeking advice from other working parents and connecting with organizations that address work and family issues, can offer useful insight and community. It's also important to have the support of your workplace. An understanding, flexible, and accommodating employer can make the return to work easier for parents and less stressful.
When I returned to work after having my second child, I was fortunate enough to work for an employer who valued their employees' family lives. My employer offered flexible work schedules, on-site lactation rooms, and a supportive community of working parents, which made a huge difference in my return to work. I was able to balance my work and parenting life and feel supported in both.
https://akash.mittal.blog/Architecture-and-Parenting-Returning-to-Work.html
#trending #ArchitectureandParenting #ReturningtoWork #WorkingParents #FamilyFriendlyWorkplaces

"The problem with weapons is that they come with instructions." - Abby Huntsman
Imagine a world where countries stop selling weapons to oppressive regimes, where guns don't end up in the hands of terrorists, and where civilians are not caught in the crossfire of armed conflicts. The Arms Trade Treaty, adopted by the United Nations in 2013, aims to make this vision a reality.
The Arms Trade Treaty aims to regulate international trade in conventional weapons and prevent their diversion to illicit or undesirable recipients. This includes small arms and light weapons - like handguns, rifles, and machine guns - as well as tanks, combat aircraft, and warships. By creating a set of international standards for authorizing weapons transfers and monitoring the end use of weapons, the Arms Trade Treaty seeks to prevent human rights abuses and promote global security.
Hashtags: #armstradetreaty #globalpeace #UN #weaponscontrol
Share on Twitter Share on LinkedIn
https://akash.mittal.blog/Arms-Trade-Treaty-A-Step-towards-Global-Peace.html
#trending #armstradetreaty #globalpeace #UN #weaponscontrol

When Barbie met Boss Beauties, it was like two worlds collided.
Barbie, the beloved doll, known for her fashion sense and charm, and Boss Beauties, an empowering organization that connects, empowers and educates women entrepreneurs, have teamed up to bring more women into Web3.
In a recent announcement, the two groups revealed their plans to launch a joint campaign that would encourage more women to embrace the Web3 movement and take advantage of the opportunities it offers.
Barbie, who has always been interested in tech, sees this partnership as a way to inspire the next generation of female tech innovators, while Boss Beauties believes that the Web3 movement offers limitless potential for women entrepreneurs.
The numbers speak for themselves. According to a recent report by the World Economic Forum, women are significantly underrepresented in the tech industry. In the United States, only 26% of computing jobs are held by women, while in Europe, women make up just 17% of the tech workforce.

It was a warm summer day, and my daughter and I were sitting in the park, enjoying the sunshine. We were discussing the latest graphic novels she had read, and she mentioned one that had really caught her attention: Adventures in Parenting. She told me it was a heartwarming and humorous account of a new mother trying to navigate the challenges of raising a child while dealing with her own insecurities and doubts.
As a parent myself, I was immediately intrigued. I knew that parenting was never an easy task, and there were always new challenges and surprises around every corner. So, I decided to check out Adventures in Parenting and was blown away by the art, the writing, and the relatable characters.
But that was just the beginning of my love affair with graphic novels. Over the course of the year, I discovered some truly amazing works that tackled everything from sun worshipping to strange gifts. Here are my top picks:
This graphic novel is a must-read for any parent or soon-to-be parent. It follows the journey of a new mother as she tries to navigate the challenges of raising a child, including sleepless nights, feeding struggles, and dealing with her own insecurities. The art is beautiful and emotive, and the writing is both heartfelt and humorous. This one had me laughing and crying in equal measure.
If you're a fan of the great outdoors, you'll love Sun Worshipping. This graphic novel takes you on a journey through the wilderness, exploring the beauty and wonder of nature. The art is stunning, with vivid colors and intricate details that bring the landscapes to life. The story is a meditation on the importance of disconnecting from technology and embracing the natural world.

Once upon a time, search engine optimization (SEO) was a fairly straightforward process. You would optimize your website content with keywords, meta tags, and backlinks and voila, you would rank on top of search engine results pages (SERPs).
However, with the ever-increasing penetration of AI and machine learning in various industries, things are changing, and so is SEO. AI has the ability to learn from vast amounts of data, which means it can quickly adapt and improve search algorithms, leading to an entirely new approach to SEO.
One major impact of AI on SEO is the increasing use of voice search. According to Google, 20% of searches on any mobile device are conducted with voice commands. As AI assistants like Siri and Alexa become more ubiquitous, this figure is expected to rise even more. This means that SEO professionals need to optimize their content to include conversational language and natural sentence structures.
Furthermore, AI-based algorithms have become smarter and more discerning in interpreting user intent. Google's RankBrain algorithm is one such example that can now analyze search queries' context and semantic meaning to produce more accurate and relevant results.
The Future of SEO: How AI is Changing the Game
https://akash.mittal.blog/Big-changes-coming-for-SEOs-with-ubiquitous-AI.html
#trending #AIandSEO #futureofSEO #SEOevolution

It's not uncommon for celebrities to come under fire from internet trolls, but when the troll has lost an infant and the celebrity responds by getting petty, it becomes a different story. Cardi B, the Grammy Award-winning rapper, found herself in hot water after she got into a heated exchange with an Instagram user who lost her infant son. In this article, we'll explore the incident in detail and speak with the lead attorney to discuss the legal implications of the case.
It all started with a meme that was posted on Instagram, which featured a photo of Cardi B and her husband, Offset, with their infant daughter Kulture. The caption read, "I hope Offset cheating on you in peace." The post quickly went viral, and one user in particular responded with a comment that read, "Why her baby don't look like her...smh." The user, whose Instagram handle was @Starmarieeee, had recently lost her infant son, and the comment struck a nerve. Cardi B responded by getting petty, going back and forth with @Starmarieeee, and bringing up the fact that the user had lost her infant son.
Cardi B's response caused a firestorm on social media, and the rapper soon found herself facing backlash from fans and critics alike. As the story continued to gain traction, the lead attorney was contacted for his expert opinion on the legal implications of the incident.
According to the lead attorney, the incident raises several important legal questions, including:
The lead attorney stated that while Cardi B's response was certainly insensitive, it is unlikely that she could be held liable for her actions. However, he cautioned that the situation could have a negative impact on Cardi B's public image, with potential consequences ranging from lost endorsements to decreased record sales.
https://akash.mittal.blog/Cardi-B-Gets-Petty-with-Internet-Troll-Who-Lost-Infant-Lead-Attorney-Speaks-Out.html
#trending #CardiB #internettrolls #socialmedia #legalimplications #celebrityattacks #internetbullying #socialresponsibility #legalconsequences #fame #publicimage #socialmediaethics #onlinetrolling

It was a hot summer day and Mary decided to crank up the air conditioner. She knew that it would cause her energy bill to go up, but she just couldn't take the heat. As the month went on, the temperature kept rising and so did her energy bill. In the end, she was stuck with a bill that was over double her usual amount. This got her thinking, does the heat affect her finances in more ways than she realized?
Mary's experience is not unique. During the summer months, many people turn up the air conditioning to stay cool. According to the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), cooling costs account for about 6% of the average household's energy expenses.
In areas with extreme heat, such as the southern and western United States, those costs can be even higher. The EIA reports that households in these regions can spend up to 20% of their energy budget on cooling.
To put that in tangible terms, let's consider a family with a monthly energy bill of $200. During the summer months, their cooling costs might account for $12 of that bill. However, if temperatures soar and they need to use more energy to stay cool, that cost could easily double to $24 or more.
But cooling costs are not the only way that heat can affect finances. When the temperatures rise, people tend to spend more on things like ice cream, cold drinks, and outdoor activities.
https://akash.mittal.blog/Do-High-Temperatures-Turn-Heat-on-Your-Finances-Too.html
#trending #heatwaves #summerexpenses #budgeting #savingmoney #energyefficiency

As artificial intelligence (AI) becomes more prevalent in our lives, so do the concerns over its potential unintended consequences. From privacy issues to bias in decision making, there are a number of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) concerns that investors need to be aware of when investing in AI-powered companies.
In March 2016, Microsoft introduced Tay, a Twitter chatbot designed to learn from its conversations with users and become more intelligent over time. However, within 24 hours, Tay had started responding to tweets with offensive and racist language, as a result of being taught by some users to become a hate-filled bot.
While Microsoft swiftly shut down the project and issued an apology, it underscored the potential dangers of AI and the importance of proper governance to prevent such unintended consequences.
Here are some examples of ESG concerns that investors should keep in mind when investing in AI:
Investors who are concerned about ESG issues related to AI should consider the following:

There is a common phrase that many parents say to their children when they criticize their parenting styles. It goes something like, "I raised you this way, and you turned out just fine." While this might be true in some cases, it doesn't necessarily mean that the parenting style was the best or most effective one out there.
As generations change, so too do parenting styles. What worked for one generation might not work for the next. For example, many Baby Boomers grew up with strict, authoritarian parents who believed in corporal punishment. However, this style of parenting was not as common for their children, the Gen Xers, and is even less common for their grandchildren, the Millennials.
So why do parenting styles change? Part of the reason has to do with societal and cultural changes over time. As we become more aware of the impact of child development and mental health, we realize that certain styles of parenting can be harmful and counterproductive. Additionally, each generation brings its own set of values and beliefs to the table, which can affect how they approach parenting.
Let's take a look at some quantifiable examples of how parenting styles have changed over the generations:
So how can parents navigate these changing parenting styles? Here are a few practical tips:

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to step inside a website and be fully immersed in its content? To interact with it in ways that feel like real life? The technology to make that a reality is already here, and it's called WebGPU.
WebGPU is a new API that allows web developers to access the full power of modern graphics processors (GPUs). This means that web browsers can now render complex 3D graphics in real time, and with high levels of detail and interactivity.
Traditionally, web graphics have been rendered using WebGL, a low-level API that is limited in its capabilities. WebGL was designed around the concept of drawing triangles in 3D space, and while it has been used to create some impressive graphics and games, it has its limitations.
WebGPU, on the other hand, was designed from the ground up for modern GPUs, and takes full advantage of the latest hardware and software technologies. It offers a much higher level of abstraction than WebGL, making it easier for developers to create complex graphics and animations.
The potential of WebGPU is huge. It opens up new possibilities for web developers to create immersive web experiences, from virtual reality (VR) environments to interactive 3D models. And because it's based on web standards, these experiences can be accessed from any device with a modern web browser, without the need for additional plugins or software.
https://akash.mittal.blog/From-Websites-To-3D-Worlds-Unlock-The-Potential-Of-Immersive-Web-With-WebGPU.html
#trending #WebGPU #ImmersiveWeb #WebDevelopment #VirtualReality #3DModels

As a person who uses the internet every day, I have seen how search engines have changed over time. I remember the days when I had to type in specific keywords to get the results I needed. But now, thanks to Google's conversational AI features, I can simply ask Google a question as if I were talking to a friend and get instant answers.
According to Google, over 70% of search queries are now in natural language form instead of specific keywords. This shows that people are increasingly comfortable with using conversational language to communicate with search engines. Additionally, Google's BERT algorithm, which uses natural language processing to better understand search queries, has improved the accuracy of search results by 10%. This means that users are more likely to find exactly what they are looking for in their search results.
The shift towards conversational AI features in search engines represents a major change in the way we interact with technology. As Google continues to innovate in this area, we can expect even more transformative changes in the near future.
One example of how conversational AI has transformed search comes from the healthcare industry. Patients can now use natural language to ask medical questions and receive instant answers. This has made it easier for patients to understand their health issues and find solutions quickly.
Another case study comes from the travel industry. With conversational AI, users can now ask for flight deals and get tailored recommendations that suit their preferences. This has made travel planning much easier and more personalized.

Do you dread composing long emails? Fear not! Thanks to Google, you can now rely on artificial intelligence to write your emails for you. This latest feature, known as 'Smart Compose', was rolled out by Google in 2018 as a Gmail feature.
The inspiration behind Google's Smart Compose technology came from the need for quicker and more efficient email responses. According to the tech giant, the average person writes 40 emails a day on average. Most of these emails are typically long-form and repetitive responses, such as scheduling appointments or answering routine queries. The conventional way of writing these emails can be time-consuming and arduous. In light of this, Google developed the AI-powered 'Smart Compose' feature to simplify the process of email writing.
The technology works by analyzing the content of your email and offering suggestions for your next sentence based on your previous writing style. Once you start typing in Gmail, Smart Compose will suggest possible sentences or key phrases that you can use to complete your message. All you need to do is press the 'tab' key to accept the suggestion.
Smart Compose incorporates natural language processing (NLP) technology to understand the intention behind the message and provide contextually relevant suggestions. The AI algorithms are designed to continuously learn from your writing patterns and improve its accuracy over time.
Google has provided several examples of Smart Compose's versatility in writing effective emails. In one instance, an employee was able to write an email ten times faster with the feature, while another study revealed that over 50% of relevant suggestions (given by Smart Compose) were accepted by Gmail users.
https://akash.mittal.blog/Google-Will-Now-Write-Your-Emails-for-You-in-Gmail-with-AI.html
#trending #Google #AI #SmartCompose #Gmail #Productivity

Once upon a time, a financial services company decided to implement an artificial intelligence (AI) system to automate their customer service process. The company had high hopes that AI would help them reduce costs, improve customer satisfaction, and increase revenue. However, after a few months of using the system, they noticed something alarming: their AI usage costs were skyrocketing, and they had no way of measuring or tracking them.
This is a common problem for organizations that use AI. While AI has the potential to save companies millions of dollars in labor costs, it can also be extremely expensive to maintain and operate. That's why Datadog, a cloud monitoring platform, has teamed up with OpenAI ChatGPT to help organizations monitor their AI usage costs.
To understand how Datadog and OpenAI ChatGPT work together to help organizations monitor AI usage costs, let's take a closer look at each platform.
Datadog is a cloud monitoring platform that provides real-time insights into an organization's cloud infrastructure, applications, and logs. Datadog can monitor over 450 integrations, including AWS, Google Cloud Platform, and Kubernetes, and provides a unified view of an organization's entire cloud environment. With Datadog, organizations can set up alerts, create custom dashboards, and analyze data to gain insights into their cloud environment.
OpenAI ChatGPT is an AI model developed by OpenAI that can generate human-like text. ChatGPT has been trained on a large corpus of text and can answer questions, generate text, and be used for a variety of applications. For example, ChatGPT can be used for customer service chatbots, language translation, and content generation.
https://akash.mittal.blog/How-Datadog-Integrates-with-OpenAI-ChatGPT-to-Help-Organizations-Monitor-AI-Usage-Costs.html
#trending #AIcostmonitoring #datadog #openai #cloudmonitoring

Do you remember the last time you had to deal with a chatbot or virtual assistant that seemed clueless about your needs? Perhaps you felt frustrated or even angry, and wished you could just speak to a human being instead. Well, the good news is that with the advances in artificial intelligence, chatbots are becoming more sophisticated and responsive. The even better news is that you can learn how to prompt them like a pro, and improve your customer service interactions in the process.
Let me share a personal experience that illustrates the potential of chatbots and AI in customer service. A few weeks ago, I needed to book a flight for a business trip. As I was browsing the airline's website, I noticed a chatbot icon on the corner of the screen. I clicked on it, and a window opened with a friendly message: "Hi, I'm Amy. How can I assist you?". I typed my request: "I need to fly from New York to London on June 15th, returning on June 22nd. What are my options?". To my surprise, Amy replied within seconds, with a list of flights that matched my criteria, along with the prices and departure times. She even asked if I needed any special assistance, such as a wheelchair or a specific meal, and offered to help with hotel reservations. I was impressed and grateful for her efficiency and empathy. I thanked her and booked the flight that suited me best. As I closed the chat window, I wondered how Amy had managed to understand my request so accurately and respond so promptly. Had she been a real person, or a computer program? What other tasks could she perform? How could I learn to prompt her even better?
If you're curious about the answers to those questions, or if you simply want to excel in your chatbot interactions, read on. In the following sections, I'll provide you with some practical tips, personal anecdotes and case studies that can help you prompt ChatGPT like a pro.
One of the most common mistakes people make when talking to chatbots is assuming that they understand synonyms, typos, or incomplete sentences. While some chatbots have natural language processing capabilities that allow them to guess the intent behind your words, most rely on pre-defined scripts or keywords to trigger their responses. Therefore, it's important to be clear and specific in your requests, and to avoid using ambiguous or colloquial expressions.
For example, instead of saying "I want to cancel my order", which could trigger a series of questions about which order, when, and why, it's better to say "I want to cancel my order #12345 that I placed on May 10th, because I changed my mind". This way, the chatbot can immediately recognize the order number, the date, and the reason for cancellation, and provide you with a relevant response, such as "Sure, I've canceled your order #12345 and refunded your payment. Is there anything else I can assist you with?".

Web 3.0, also known as the decentralized web or the semantic web, is the next phase of the internet. It involves a shift towards a more open and decentralized internet, where users have more control over their data and interactions. For entrepreneurs, this has significant implications for how they do business and interact with their audiences.
One of the key aspects of Web 3.0 is decentralization. Instead of relying on centralized platforms like Facebook or Google, web 3.0 technologies like blockchain and peer-to-peer networks allow for decentralized, trustless interactions between users.
For entrepreneurs, this means they can build applications and services that don't rely on centralized intermediaries. For example, a social media platform built on a decentralized network could give users more control over their data and interactions, while also enabling them to earn rewards for contributing to the network.
Decentralization also has implications for fundraising. Through initial coin offerings (ICOs) or token sales, entrepreneurs can raise funds for their projects directly from the community. This is a departure from traditional funding models, which often involve pitching to venture capitalists or angel investors.
Another key aspect of Web 3.0 is interoperability. This means different applications and services can communicate and interact with each other, even if they're built on different platforms or networks.

As a parent, it can be tough to watch your child grow up and start navigating the world on their own. For me, one of the biggest challenges has been watching my daughter date. Don't get me wrong, I want her to be happy and find love, but seeing her face the same challenges and heartbreaks that I did is hard. In this article, I'll share some of my insights on the challenges of parenting, especially when it comes to my daughter's dating habits.
One of the most important things you can do as a parent is to set clear boundaries and expectations from the start. This means talking to your child about what you expect from their behavior and how they should treat others in relationships. It also means setting limits on things like curfew and access to technology. By establishing these guidelines early on, you can help your child navigate the world of dating with more confidence and support.
For me, this has meant having some tough conversations with my daughter. We've talked about what she wants in a relationship, what her values are, and how she can recognize unhealthy behaviors. We've also talked about things like sex and contraception, and I've encouraged her to make responsible choices. By being open and honest about these topics, I hope to give my daughter the tools she needs to make good decisions.
It can be tempting as a parent to let your child handle everything on their own, especially as they get older. But I believe it's important to stay involved in your child's life, even as they start to date. This might mean asking questions about who they're seeing and what they're doing, or it might mean offering words of support and encouragement. Whatever it looks like for you, find ways to stay connected to your child and their experiences.
For me, this has meant showing up for my daughter in small but meaningful ways. I've gone to her school dances, helped her pick out outfits for dates, and even given some dating advice (although I know she doesn't always want to hear it). I try to strike a balance between letting her make her own decisions and being there for her when she needs me. By staying involved, I hope to show my daughter that I care and that she can come to me with anything.

When it comes to pregnancy and parenting, there are some mysteries that are hard to explain. From strange cravings to unexplainable phenomena, these experiences can leave new parents feeling bewildered and confused. In this article, we'll explore some of the most unexplainable mysteries of pregnancy and parenting, and attempt to shed some light on these strange phenomena.
One of the strangest mysteries of pregnancy is the phenomenon of cravings. While it's normal to experience some cravings during pregnancy, some pregnant women report an intense desire for foods that they've never liked before, or even foods that are considered inedible or dangerous.
Take the case of Maria, a pregnant woman who reported to her doctor that she was experiencing a strong craving for dirt. Yes, you heard that right â dirt. After some investigation, the doctor discovered that Maria was suffering from a condition known as geophagia, which is a form of pica, a disorder that involves eating non-food items.
While the exact cause of cravings during pregnancy is unknown, some theories suggest that hormonal changes, nutritional deficiencies, or cultural influences may play a role. Whatever the cause, it's important for pregnant women to be mindful of their cravings and to consult with their healthcare provider if they experience any unusual or intense cravings.
